meanings.definition: Combine (two or more things) to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: I will integrate the flour and sugar to make a cake.
meanings.sent2: It is important to integrate all the ingredients for the recipe to turn out well.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to integrate the chocolate and marshmallows for a unique dessert.
meanings.sent4: She was able to integrate her love for music and painting into a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces integrate perfectly to reveal the hidden picture.

meanings.definition: Bring (people or groups with particular characteristics or needs) into equal participation in or membership of a social group or institution.
meanings.sent1: The school aims to integrate students of all backgrounds into various clubs.
meanings.sent2: It is important to integrate everyone in the community for a harmonious society.
meanings.sent3: The party planner had to integrate guests of different ages to ensure a fun event.
meanings.sent4: She worked hard to integrate new employees into the company culture.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's goal is to integrate all students into classroom activities.

meanings.definition: Incorporate (a thing) as part of a whole.
meanings.sent1: I will integrate the new data into the presentation before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to integrate the latest research findings into the report.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to integrate a pop of color into the painting for contrast.
meanings.sent4: She was able to integrate feedback from various sources to improve her project.
meanings.sent5: The architect plans to integrate sustainable materials into the design for eco-friendliness.
